Pre-Game Insights: Guinea-Bissau participated in the Africa Cup of Nations for the fourth time and is looking for its first win in the history of the competition.
Equatorial Guinea showed readiness to challenge for a place in the next round with a 1-1 draw against Nigeria.
Equatorial Guinea comes into the game with an 11-game unbeaten run but only five wins in that time.
Guinea-Bissau has a shaky recent record, with four wins, two draws, and four defeats in their last ten games.
Post-Match Reflections: Jefferson Encada (Guinea-Bissau) beats his marker and fires a powerful shot from the edge of the box. Jesus Owono sees the ball late on but manages to prevent it from going into the right side of the goal.
VAR! The Guinea-Bissau players' joy may be justified, as referee Samuel Uwikunda will use VAR to check for offside on the previous shot.
Zé Turbo (Guinea-Bissau) sees his goal disallowed for offside!
We have 8 minutes of extra time.
Guinea-Bissau didn't take advantage of the corner to score. The opposing defense was alert and cleared the danger.
That's all for Emilio Nsue, who will be replaced by the rested Noe Ela (Equatorial Guinea).
Luis Asue (Equatorial Guinea) is shown the yellow card.
The coach decided to replace Josete Miranda with Luis Asue (Equatorial Guinea).
Samuel Uwikunda blows the whistle for a foul. Carlos Akapo (Equatorial Guinea) brings down one of his opponents. Guinea-Bissau can take the free-kick.
The coach decided to replace Pablo Ganet (Equatorial Guinea) with Santiago Eneme.
Miscellaneous Highlights: After VAR analysis, the referee confirms Zé Turbo's goal: 4-2.
Marciano Sanca (Guinea-Bissau) tries a through ball, but the defense blocks it. The assistant referee is correct and Guinea-Bissau is awarded a corner.
Others: Mama Baldé, born in Portugal, has been playing for the Guinea-Bissau national team since 2019.
Emilio Nsue, the team's all-time leading scorer with 17 goals, is the team's most experienced player.
The match will have a minimum of 6 minutes extra time.
